title: Lothar Matthäus
summary: Lothar Herbert Matthäus (German pronunciation: [ˈloːtaʁ maˈtɛːʊs], audio ;[1]  born 21 March 1961) is a German football manager and former player. After captaining West Germany to victory in the 1990 FIFA World Cup where he lifted the World Cup trophy, he was awarded the Ballon d'or. In 1991, he was named the first FIFA World Player of the Year, and remains the only German to have received the award. He was also included in the Ballon d'Or Dream Team in 2020.
